pullRequest.title: Fixes #3436 and #2881: Media Detail design Overhaul
pullRequest.bodyText:
Design Overhaul for Media Detail
Fixes #3436  - Switch to Material Card design for the Media Detail Fragment
and
Fixes #2881 - New Media Details UI
What changes did you make and why?
Changed Media details as per Neslihan's design in #2881 , however the bookmarks and the downloads panel has been kept in the App Bar at the top
Here is how it looks now

commit.message: ic_map_dark_24dp: map icon for white background
ic_info_outline_dark_24dp: info icon for dark background
MediaDetailFragment: update the spacer as per image aspect ratio

nodes.bodyText: This no longer changes color in dark theme, using attributes is preferred
Is this necessary? It should by default have no color

commit.message: fragment_media_detail: remove redundant background color statements
white map icon in dark mode

nodes.bodyText: Can we write javadocs in /**/ format. You can check other methods in our code for having an example.

So you have this <Linear><Text>Text></> pattern repeated all over the place. There are 2 options that will give us actual control over the rendering here.

Use 3 styles, 1 for each component. Right click>refactor>extract>style
Create a custom View Component so instead of declaring 3 view elements you declare 1

nodes.bodyText:
I personally really hate the weightsum attribute. You can omit it if you have specified the weight of every child view, using weightsum should be to change the default behaviour of not specifying the weight of a view, which is a bad practice anyway, just specify the weight of every child if you are positioning them proportionately.
This is of course all legacy knowledge, best practice is use constraintlayout everywhere* and probably in a years time use Compose everywhere.
